creator: odi@odi.ch
text:
The documentation says the file attribute is required. In fact Ant does not
support the file attribute any longer (? at least I get an error message when I
use it).

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
How do you use it?

There are (at least) two different <manifest> elements possible in a build file.
One is a task (and this one requires the file attribute) and one is the nested
child of <jar> which does not support the file attribute.

creator: odi@odi.ch
text:
I am using <manifest> tag nested inside a <jar> element:

    <jar destfile="${dist.dir}/${dist.jar}">
      <fileset dir="${classes.dir}" includes="ch/**"/>
      <fileset dir="${lib.dir}"/>
      <manifest>
        <attribute name="Class-Path" value="${class.path}"/>
        <attribute name="Main-Class" value="${main.class}"/>
      </manifest>
    </jar>

Oh, I just found this in the <jar> doc:
"This element [manifest] is identical to the manifest task, but its file and
mode attributes will be ignored."

Maybe this should read "file and mode attribute must be omitted". A similar
statement in the <manifest> documentation is missing.
